title: Isaiah Chapter 19 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Isaiah chapter 19 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Isaiah Chapter 19 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Isaiah Chapter 19.

questions.question: Who does the LORD ride upon as He comes into Egypt according to Isaiah 19:1?
options: A swift cloud
A chariot of fire
A mighty horse
A winged eagle
questions.correctAnswer: A swift cloud
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:1 states that the LORD rideth upon a swift cloud as He comes into Egypt.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 19:2, whom will the Egyptians fight against?
options: Every one against his brother
The Philistines
The Assyrians
The Babylonians
questions.correctAnswer: Every one against his brother
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:2 states that the Egyptians shall fight everyone against his brother and neighbor.

questions.question: What will happen to the spirit of Egypt as described in Isaiah 19:3?
options: The spirit of Egypt shall fail
The spirit of Egypt shall prosper
The spirit of Egypt shall rejoice
The spirit of Egypt shall be strengthened
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit of Egypt shall fail
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:3 says the spirit of Egypt shall fail in the midst thereof.

questions.question: Who will rule over the Egyptians as said in Isaiah 19:4?
options: A cruel lord and fierce king
A wise king
A peaceful prince
A foreign governor
questions.correctAnswer: A cruel lord and fierce king
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:4 declares that a cruel lord and fierce king shall rule over Egypt.

questions.question: What will happen to the waters and rivers in Egypt according to Isaiah 19:5?
options: The waters shall fail and the river shall be dried up
The waters shall overflow
The rivers shall be filled with fish
The waters shall be blessed
questions.correctAnswer: The waters shall fail and the river shall be dried up
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:5 states the waters shall fail from the sea, and the river shall be wasted and dried up.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 19:11, how are the princes of Zoan described?
options: Fools
Wise
Brave
Faithful
questions.correctAnswer: Fools
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:11 calls the princes of Zoan fools and their counsel brutish.

questions.question: What has the LORD mingled in the midst of Egypt as stated in Isaiah 19:14?
options: A perverse spirit
A spirit of peace
A spirit of joy
A spirit of wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: A perverse spirit
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:14 mentions that the LORD hath mingled a perverse spirit in the midst of Egypt.

questions.question: How will Egypt be described in 'that day' according to Isaiah 19:16?
options: Like unto women, afraid and fearful
Strong and victorious
Joyful and prosperous
Silent and peaceful
questions.correctAnswer: Like unto women, afraid and fearful
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:16 says Egypt shall be like unto women and shall fear because of the LORD's hand.

questions.question: Which land shall be a terror unto Egypt according to Isaiah 19:17?
options: Judah
Babylon
Assyria
Edom
questions.correctAnswer: Judah
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:17 states that the land of Judah shall be a terror unto Egypt.

questions.question: How many cities in Egypt shall speak the language of Canaan in 'that day' as per Isaiah 19:18?
options: Five
Three
Seven
Ten
questions.correctAnswer: Five
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:18 mentions that five cities shall speak the language of Canaan.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 19:20 says there will be an altar to the LORD in the midst of Egypt.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:20 confirms there shall be an altar to the LORD in the midst of Egypt.

questions.question: True or False: According to Isaiah 19:22, the LORD will only smite Egypt but not heal it.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:22 says the LORD shall smite Egypt and heal it, showing both judgment and restoration.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 19:24 declares Israel will be a curse in the midst of the land.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:24 states Israel shall be a blessing in the midst of the land, not a curse.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'In that day shall there be an altar to the LORD in the midst of the land of ___,' from Isaiah 19:19.
options: Egypt
Judah
Assyria
Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: Egypt
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:19 clearly states that there will be an altar to the LORD in the midst of the land of Egypt.

questions.question: Complete the phrase from Isaiah 19:23: 'In that day shall there be a highway out of ___ to Assyria.'
options: Egypt
Judah
Babylon
Moab
questions.correctAnswer: Egypt
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:23 says there shall be a highway out of Egypt to Assyria in that day.

medium.title: Isaiah Chapter 19 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Isaiah Chapter 19 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Isaiah 19, what biblical truth would you share about trusting God's sovereignty in hardship?
options: God is actively involved even in difficult times and will eventually bring healing and deliverance.
Hardships mean God has abandoned His people and they must rely solely on themselves.
Idols and worldly wisdom are the best sources of comfort during trials.
God’s judgment is final and irreversible, so there is no hope for restoration.
questions.correctAnswer: God is actively involved even in difficult times and will eventually bring healing and deliverance.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:4, 22 explain that God allows trials but also promises healing and restoration, showing His sovereignty and care. Verses 20-22 emphasize God sending a savior and healing Egypt after smiting it.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 19, how should Christians view human wisdom and counsel in contrast to God's plan?
options: Human wisdom can be foolish and deceptive compared to God's perfect counsel.
Human wisdom is always superior and should be trusted over God’s word.
God’s plans are uncertain and need human wisdom to be effective.
Counselors and wise men are always reliable guides for faith decisions.
questions.correctAnswer: Human wisdom can be foolish and deceptive compared to God's perfect counsel.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:11-14 illustrate that the princes and wise men of Egypt became fools and were deceived, showing human wisdom’s limits against God's sovereign counsel.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with division in their church. What principle about unity and conflict can be drawn from Isaiah 19 to encourage them?
options: Division weakens communities and results from straying from God’s guidance.
Conflict is a sign of spiritual strength and should be embraced.
Division is inevitable and shows God’s displeasure with the people.
Fighting among believers is acceptable if it defends personal rights.
questions.correctAnswer: Division weakens communities and results from straying from God’s guidance.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:2 describes Egyptians fighting each other and city against city, symbolizing the destructive effects of disobedience and lack of trust in God’s leadership.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 19 encourage believers to maintain integrity and trust in God rather than idols or false practices?
options: God warns that reliance on idols and charms leads to failure and confusion.
Idols and familiar spirits provide true guidance and should be trusted.
Integrity is less important than success by any means necessary.
Trusting in charms ensures protection from trials.
questions.correctAnswer: God warns that reliance on idols and charms leads to failure and confusion.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:3 highlights that Egypt’s counsel is destroyed because they seek help from idols, charmers, and wizards instead of God, teaching the importance of integrity and trust in Him.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged because their efforts in service seem fruitless. What teaching from Isaiah 19 can provide hope and encouragement?
options: God will ultimately bring restoration and bless those who remain faithful.
All efforts are meaningless and should be abandoned.
Success comes only from human wisdom and effort.
Trials mean God has rejected their service permanently.
questions.correctAnswer: God will ultimately bring restoration and bless those who remain faithful.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:22-25 shows that despite hardship, God will heal Egypt and bless His people, encouraging perseverance and faithfulness in service.

questions.question: Based on Isaiah 19, what role does prayer and crying out to God play in times of oppression or hardship?
options: Prayer is a sign of faith that prompts God to send deliverance and a savior.
Prayer is ineffective and does not change God’s plans.
Only human effort matters, not prayer, during oppression.
Praying to idols is more effective than praying to God.
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer is a sign of faith that prompts God to send deliverance and a savior.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:20 states that when the Egyptians cry to the LORD because of oppressors, He will send them a savior and deliver them, showing prayer’s power.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 19 teaches that God’s judgment on Egypt is final with no promise of healing or restoration.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:22 explains that the LORD will smite Egypt but also heal it, showing both judgment and restoration are part of God’s plan.

questions.question: True or False: According to Isaiah 19, the language and worship of Egypt will change to acknowledge the LORD in the future.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:18-21 describe a time when cities in Egypt will speak the language of Canaan and swear to the LORD, showing a future turning to God.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Isaiah 19 states that in the day of the LORD’s intervention, Egypt shall be like unto _______, afraid because of God's judgment.
options: women
kings
warriors
mountains
questions.correctAnswer: women
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:16 says Egypt shall be like unto women, trembling and afraid because of the shaking of the LORD’s hand, symbolizing vulnerability and fear in the face of God’s power.

questions.question: What practical lesson about humility and contentment can be learned from the description of Egypt’s failure in Isaiah 19?
options: Pride in human wisdom leads to downfall and confusion.
Contentment comes from material wealth and power.
Humility is unnecessary when one has strong leadership.
Self-reliance guarantees success regardless of obedience.
questions.correctAnswer: Pride in human wisdom leads to downfall and confusion.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:11-14 shows that Egyptian leaders’ pride in their wisdom made them fools, causing the nation to stumble and err, teaching the need for humility before God.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 19 encourage believers to share the gospel and be a witness through fellowship and unity?
options: God will unite formerly hostile nations, showing His power and blessing.
Evangelism is unnecessary because God only blesses one nation.
Division among believers strengthens the gospel message.
Witnessing requires political power and military strength.
questions.correctAnswer: God will unite formerly hostile nations, showing His power and blessing.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:23-25 foretells a highway between Egypt, Assyria, and Israel, uniting them in blessing by the LORD, demonstrating the power of gospel unity.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to rely on worldly wisdom rather than God’s Word in decision making. What warning from Isaiah 19 would you share?
options: Relying on human wisdom without God leads to foolishness and error.
Worldly wisdom is a reliable guide for spiritual matters.
God’s Word is outdated and less practical than current knowledge.
Counselors and wise men never fail in their advice.
questions.correctAnswer: Relying on human wisdom without God leads to foolishness and error.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:12-14 shows wise men and princes becoming fools and deceiving the nation, warning against trusting worldly wisdom over God’s guidance.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 19 teach us about perseverance through trials and trusting God’s timing?
options: Despite suffering, God promises eventual healing and blessing.
Trials mean God’s favor is lost forever.
Perseverance is futile without immediate results.
God’s timing is irrelevant to human faithfulness.
questions.correctAnswer: Despite suffering, God promises eventual healing and blessing.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:22-25 emphasize that after judgment, God will heal Egypt and bless His people, encouraging believers to persevere in faith.

questions.question: What biblical truth about generosity and stewardship can be inferred from the restoration described in Isaiah 19?
options: God blesses nations and people when they return to Him and worship rightly.
Wealth and blessing come only from personal effort without God.
Stewardship is unnecessary because God’s blessings are automatic.
Generosity results in loss rather than blessing.
questions.correctAnswer: God blesses nations and people when they return to Him and worship rightly.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:21-25 show that returning to the LORD with sacrifices and vows results in blessing, underscoring stewardship and generosity in worship.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 19 illustrate the importance of humility in leadership and service within the family or church?
options: Prideful leaders become fools and lead others astray, causing harm.
Leadership success depends entirely on personal ambition.
Humility is a weakness in leadership roles.
Service is unnecessary when one holds authority.
questions.correctAnswer: Prideful leaders become fools and lead others astray, causing harm.
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:11-13 describe the princes of Zoan and Noph becoming fools and deceiving Egypt, showing the damage of prideful leadership.

hard.title: Isaiah Chapter 19 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Isaiah Chapter 19.

questions.question: What is the initial sign of God's coming judgment upon Egypt as described in Isaiah 19:1?
options: The idols of Egypt shall be moved at His presence
The rivers of Egypt shall overflow
The Egyptians shall build new altars
Pharaoh shall conquer neighboring lands
questions.correctAnswer: The idols of Egypt shall be moved at His presence
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:1 states that the LORD will come into Egypt and the idols of Egypt shall be moved at His presence, signaling the divine judgment.

questions.question: Isaiah 19:2 describes a conflict within Egypt. What form does this conflict take?
options: Egyptians shall fight every one against his brother and neighbor
Egypt shall ally with Assyria against Israel
The Nile shall flood the cities
Pharaoh shall be overthrown by foreign invaders
questions.correctAnswer: Egyptians shall fight every one against his brother and neighbor
questions.explanation: The verse describes internal strife, where Egyptians will be set against each other, causing civil conflict.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 19:3, what happens to the spirit and counsel of Egypt?
options: The spirit shall fail and the counsel shall be destroyed
The spirit shall be strengthened by idols
The counsel shall prevail over neighboring kingdoms
The spirit shall be renewed by the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit shall fail and the counsel shall be destroyed
questions.explanation: The verse explains that the spirit of Egypt will fail and the counsel of the Egyptians will be destroyed, leading them to seek help from idols and sorcerers.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Isaiah 19:4 states, 'And the Egyptians will I give over into the hand of a _______; and a fierce king shall rule over them.'
options: cruel lord
foreign prince
gentle shepherd
wise counselor
questions.correctAnswer: cruel lord
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states that Egypt will be handed over to a cruel lord who will fiercely rule over them.

questions.question: What natural disaster is prophesied in Isaiah 19:5-7 affecting Egypt?
options: The waters shall fail, and rivers shall dry up
A great earthquake shall destroy the cities
A plague of locusts will devour the crops
A storm of fire will burn the land
questions.correctAnswer: The waters shall fail, and rivers shall dry up
questions.explanation: These verses describe drying up of waters from the sea and rivers, along with withering reeds and plants, signifying drought and ecological collapse.

questions.question: Isaiah 19:8 and 19:9 mention the mourning of certain groups. Who are these groups?
options: Fishers and those who work in flax and weave networks
Farmers and shepherds
Priests and prophets
Merchants and soldiers
questions.correctAnswer: Fishers and those who work in flax and weave networks
questions.explanation: The text laments the plight of fishers and workers in flax and weaving because their livelihoods depend on the dried-up waters and economic collapse.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 19:11-13 characterize the leaders of Egypt, particularly the princes of Zoan and Noph?
options: Fools and deceived, having seduced Egypt
Wise and faithful counselors to Pharaoh
Strong warriors defending the nation
Just rulers carrying out divine judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Fools and deceived, having seduced Egypt
questions.explanation: These verses describe the princes as fools and deceived leaders who have misled Egypt, indicating failed leadership during crisis.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 19:14 says the LORD has caused a perverse spirit to mingle among Egypt, leading them to err like a drunken man.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly states that the LORD mingled a perverse spirit causing Egypt's erring and staggering, symbolizing divine judgment.

questions.question: What metaphor is used in Isaiah 19:16 to describe Egypt's condition when the LORD shakes His hand over it?
options: Egypt shall be like unto women, afraid and fearful
Egypt shall roar like a lion
Egypt shall stand unshaken like a mountain
Egypt shall be as a mighty eagle
questions.correctAnswer: Egypt shall be like unto women, afraid and fearful
questions.explanation: The verse uses a simile comparing Egypt's fearfulness to that of women trembling at the LORD's shaking hand, highlighting vulnerability.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 19:17, which land is said to become a terror unto Egypt?
options: Judah
Assyria
Babylon
Moab
questions.correctAnswer: Judah
questions.explanation: The text indicates Judah will be a terror to Egypt, causing fear due to the LORD's counsel against Egypt.

questions.question: What significant religious development is prophesied in Isaiah 19:18 regarding five cities in Egypt?
options: They shall speak the language of Canaan and swear to the LORD of hosts
They shall build temples to Egyptian gods only
They shall revolt and reject all foreign influence
They shall remain loyal to Pharaoh only
questions.correctAnswer: They shall speak the language of Canaan and swear to the LORD of hosts
questions.explanation: This verse foretells a spiritual renewal where some Egyptian cities adopt the language and worship of the LORD, showing future unity.

questions.question: What symbolic structures does Isaiah 19:19 say will be established in Egypt 'in that day'?
options: An altar to the LORD and a pillar at the border
A new palace for Pharaoh
A temple to the sun god Ra
A fortress to guard the Nile
questions.correctAnswer: An altar to the LORD and a pillar at the border
questions.explanation: The altar and pillar symbolize worship and a covenant witness to the LORD in Egypt, marking a theological shift.

questions.question: Isaiah 19:20 mentions a saviour sent by the LORD to Egypt. What is the reason for sending this saviour?
options: Because they cried unto the LORD because of the oppressors
To conquer Assyria
To rebuild the Egyptian temples
To lead a military campaign
questions.correctAnswer: Because they cried unto the LORD because of the oppressors
questions.explanation: The saviour is sent as a response to Egypt’s cry for help against oppressors, indicating divine deliverance.

questions.question: Isaiah 19:22 presents a paradoxical action by the LORD toward Egypt. What is it?
options: He will smite Egypt, then heal it
He will abandon Egypt forever
He will make Egypt invincible
He will destroy all of Egypt's idols
questions.correctAnswer: He will smite Egypt, then heal it
questions.explanation: The LORD's action includes both judgment and restoration, demonstrating mercy after discipline.

questions.question: What unusual alliance is described in Isaiah 19:23-24 involving Egypt, Assyria, and Israel?
options: A highway connecting Egypt and Assyria, with Israel as a blessing in the midst
A war alliance against Babylon
A trade embargo against Judah
A religious council to oppose idolatry
questions.correctAnswer: A highway connecting Egypt and Assyria, with Israel as a blessing in the midst
questions.explanation: The passage forecasts unity and cooperation between these traditional enemies, with Israel as a mediating blessing.

theological.title: Isaiah Chapter 19 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Isaiah Chapter 19 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 19:1, what is the nature of the LORD's coming into Egypt?
options: He rideth upon a swift cloud
He comes with a mighty army
He sends a prophet
He descends as fire
questions.correctAnswer: He rideth upon a swift cloud
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:1 depicts the LORD coming into Egypt riding upon a swift cloud, symbolizing His divine power and sudden presence. This imagery is consistent with other scriptures like Exodus 19:9, Psalm 104:3, and Revelation 14:14 that portray God’s majestic and swift intervention.

questions.question: What internal conflict does God declare will occur in Egypt as per Isaiah 19:2?
options: Egyptians will fight against Egyptians
Egypt will unite against Assyria
Egypt will seek peace with Israel
Egypt will worship the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Egyptians will fight against Egyptians
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:2 states that God will set Egyptians against each other, causing brother to fight brother, city against city, and kingdom against kingdom. This theme of internal strife due to divine judgment aligns with passages such as Micah 7:6, Mark 13:12, and Luke 21:16.

questions.question: Isaiah 19:3 mentions that the spirit of Egypt shall fail. What will the Egyptians seek after this failure?
options: Idols, charmers, familiar spirits, and wizards
The LORD and His prophets
Wisdom from Egypt's sages
Alliances with foreign nations
questions.correctAnswer: Idols, charmers, familiar spirits, and wizards
questions.explanation: Verse 3 indicates that after the spirit of Egypt fails, they will turn to idols and occult practices for counsel. This reflects the futility of trusting in anything other than God, echoed in Deuteronomy 18:10-12, Jeremiah 10:2-5, Acts 19:19, and Galatians 5:20.

questions.question: Who does God say will rule over Egypt as a consequence of their judgment in Isaiah 19:4?
options: A cruel lord and a fierce king
A righteous priest-king
The LORD Himself
The king of Assyria
questions.correctAnswer: A cruel lord and a fierce king
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:4 describes God delivering Egypt into the hands of a cruel lord and fierce king as judgment. This illustrates God's sovereignty in raising and removing rulers (Daniel 4:17, Romans 13:1), often to execute His purposes (Exodus 9:16, Habakkuk 1:5).

questions.question: What environmental calamity is foretold for Egypt in Isaiah 19:5-7?
options: Waters shall fail, rivers dry up, and plants wither
A great earthquake will destroy cities
A famine of bread will afflict the land
Locusts will consume the crops
questions.correctAnswer: Waters shall fail, rivers dry up, and plants wither
questions.explanation: Verses 5 to 7 prophesy a drying up of water sources and withering of plants, signifying divine judgment impacting Egypt’s lifeblood, the Nile. This theme of water judgment is seen in Exodus 7:17-21, Revelation 16:4, Joel 1:20, and Jeremiah 14:1-6.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 19:11, how does God describe the wise counselors of Pharaoh?
options: Fools and brutish
Wise and discerning
Faithful and just
Silent and fearful
questions.correctAnswer: Fools and brutish
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:11 calls the princes and counselors of Pharaoh fools, highlighting their inability to provide true wisdom or deliverance. This theme is consistent with Proverbs 1:7, Jeremiah 4:22, 1 Corinthians 1:25, and Romans 1:22 which contrast human folly with divine wisdom.

questions.question: Isaiah 19:14 states that the LORD has mingled a perverse spirit in Egypt. What effect does this have on Egypt’s actions?
options: Causes Egypt to err in every work as a drunken man staggers
Leads Egypt to repentance and faith
Unites Egypt with Israel
Brings prosperity and peace
questions.correctAnswer: Causes Egypt to err in every work as a drunken man staggers
questions.explanation: Verse 14 describes a perverse spirit causing Egypt to stumble irrationally, like a drunken man, signifying divine judgment and confusion. Similar spiritual confusion is noted in 1 Kings 22:23, Romans 1:28, Proverbs 5:22, and Isaiah 29:10.

questions.question: In Isaiah 19:16, what metaphor is used to describe Egypt's condition when the LORD shakes His hand over it?
options: Egypt shall be like unto women, afraid and fearful
Egypt shall be like a lion, roaring in defiance
Egypt shall be like a tree, strong and unyielding
Egypt shall be like a mountain, unmoved
questions.correctAnswer: Egypt shall be like unto women, afraid and fearful
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:16 uses the metaphor of Egypt being like women, trembling with fear at God’s hand, illustrating vulnerability and helplessness before divine judgment. This imagery parallels Hosea 13:8, Luke 21:26, Psalm 68:11, and Revelation 6:15-17.

questions.question: What fearful role does the land of Judah have in relation to Egypt according to Isaiah 19:17?
options: Judah shall be a terror unto Egypt
Judah shall be conquered by Egypt
Judah shall serve Egypt
Judah and Egypt shall unite in peace
questions.correctAnswer: Judah shall be a terror unto Egypt
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:17 states Judah will be a terror to Egypt, causing fear due to the LORD’s counsel against Egypt. This reflects God’s use of nations for His purposes, as seen in 2 Chronicles 16:7-9, Ezekiel 25:3-7, Habakkuk 1:5, and Romans 9:17.

questions.question: In Isaiah 19:18, what significant change will occur in five cities of Egypt?
options: They shall speak the language of Canaan and swear to the LORD
They shall be destroyed by fire
They shall be ruled by Assyria
They shall become centers of idol worship
questions.correctAnswer: They shall speak the language of Canaan and swear to the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 18 prophesies that five cities in Egypt will adopt the language of Canaan and swear allegiance to the LORD, indicating a turning to God and inclusion in His covenant community. This theme of Gentile inclusion appears in Acts 10:34-35, Isaiah 56:3-8, Romans 15:9, and Galatians 3:28.

questions.question: What will be established in the midst of Egypt as a sign and witness to the LORD according to Isaiah 19:19-20?
options: An altar and a pillar
A temple of idols
A palace for the king
A large city wall
questions.correctAnswer: An altar and a pillar
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:19-20 foretells an altar and pillar to the LORD in Egypt, serving as a sign and witness of faith and divine intervention. This recalls the altar of witness built by Joshua (Joshua 22:10-34) and the pillar at Bethel (Genesis 28:18), symbolizing covenant relationship and remembrance.

questions.question: Who will the LORD send to Egypt when they cry out because of their oppressors as stated in Isaiah 19:20?
options: A saviour and a great one who will deliver them
An angel of destruction
A foreign king
A prophet of doom
questions.correctAnswer: A saviour and a great one who will deliver them
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:20 promises God will send a saviour, a deliverer, to Egypt when they call out due to oppression. This messianic deliverance anticipates Christ’s role as Savior (Luke 2:11, John 4:42, Isaiah 53:4-5, Romans 11:26).

questions.question: What is the spiritual outcome for Egypt described in Isaiah 19:21-22?
options: Egypt will know the LORD, return to Him, and be healed
Egypt will be destroyed without hope
Egypt will become a center of idolatry
Egypt will rebel and be hardened
questions.correctAnswer: Egypt will know the LORD, return to Him, and be healed
questions.explanation: Verses 21-22 reveal a hopeful restoration where Egypt will come to know the LORD, offer sacrifices, and be healed after divine judgment. This mirrors themes of repentance and healing in 2 Chronicles 7:14, Joel 2:25, Jeremiah 3:22, and Acts 3:19.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 19:23, what new relationship will exist between Egypt and Assyria?
options: There will be a highway connecting them and mutual service
They will remain enemies and hostile
Assyria will conquer Egypt permanently
Egypt will isolate itself from Assyria
questions.correctAnswer: There will be a highway connecting them and mutual service
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:23 foresees a highway linking Egypt and Assyria and mutual service between them, symbolizing reconciliation and unity under God’s blessing. This unity among former enemies is echoed in Ezekiel 37:15-22, Isaiah 11:13, Galatians 3:28, and Revelation 7:9.

questions.question: What is Israel's role in relation to Egypt and Assyria in Isaiah 19:24?
options: Israel will be the third party and a blessing among them
Israel will be destroyed by both nations
Israel will dominate and rule over them
Israel will be isolated from both nations
questions.correctAnswer: Israel will be the third party and a blessing among them
questions.explanation: Isaiah 19:24 declares Israel as the third with Egypt and Assyria, serving as a blessing in the land, reflecting God's plan for Israel to be a light and mediator (Genesis 12:3, Isaiah 42:6, Matthew 5:14, Romans 11:11).
